chapter.title: Fixes, Limitations, & Known Issues
chapter.para: ${projectName} issues are tracked at . This chapter covers the status of key issues and limitations at release ${docTargetVersion}.

section.title: Fixes
section.para: The following issues were fixed in release ${docTargetVersion}.

listitem.para: OPENIG-370: Log output often includes irrelevant or duplicated information
OPENIG-368: OAuth2ClientFilter rebases client endpoint against possibly rebased request.uri
OPENIG-331: Moving a file in Routes may result in no route configured
OPENIG-325: Allow scripts and AssignmentFilters to update exchange.request.uri
OPENIG-312: Use Jackson for better messages about configuration errors in JSON
OPENIG-85: SqlAttributesFilter throws SQLException: Invalid operation for forward only resultset
OPENIG-78: SqlAttributesFilter throws SQLException: Invalid column index
OPENIG-30: OpenIG to protect multiple apps at one location

section.para: The ForgeRock issue tracker gives you access to the complete list of resolved issues.

section.title: Limitations
section.para: For HTTPS, ${projectName} can check server certificates. However mutual authentication, where ${projectName} presents its client certificate, is not supported if the client certificate is not the first certificate in the HttpClient key store.
${projectName} scripts are not sandboxed, but instead have access to anything in their environment. You must make sure that the scripts that ${projectName} loads are safe.
When acting as an OpenID Connect 1.0 relying party, ${projectName} does not support dynamic registration.

section.title: Known Issues
section.para: The following known issues remained open at the time release ${docTargetVersion} became available.

listitem.para: OPENIG-322: Cannot access both an OpenAM (self-signed) and a Google HTTPS endpoint
OPENIG-290: Null pointer exception when capturing SAML federation response
OPENIG-258: OpenIG doesn't shutdown properly when protected by a Tomcat J2EE agent
OPENIG-234: Federation doesn't work if we used incomplete user in IDP
